Award.AwardTitle: EAGER: Novel Nano-hybrid Structured Regioregular Polyhexylthiophenes Blend Films for Organic Photovoltaic Applications

Division.LongName: Div Of Electrical, Commun & Cyber Sys

Award.AbstractNarration:
The objective of this EAGER grant is to seek seed funding for the proof-of-concept demonstration through fabrication; testing and measurement of nanodiamond?ragioregular polyhexylthiophene (RRPHTh) conjugated polymer nanohybrid organic photovoltaic cell. Our approach is to fabricate the photovoltaic device consisting of conducting/ND-conjugated polymer/Electrolyte/Graphene/Conducting and Al/ND-RRPHThs/Graphene/conducting electrode structures. The film of nanodiamond-RRPHTh, and homologues conducting polymer structured will be exploited for fabrication of efficient organic photovoltaic cell.

Intellectual Merit: The research will develop for the first time, the photovoltaic device using nanodiamond- RRPHTh or ND-other homologous conjugated polymers nanohybrid film over entire solar spectrum. The target of the work is to enhance photoelectrochemical and solid photovoltaic (PV) effect, and eliminate the recombination of photo induced charge carriers. The investigators will analyze and compare the device with existing technologies. We will also investigate and design a new generation efficient photovoltaic cells to increase the efficiency than observed in any organic based photovoltaic devices.

Broader Impacts: Successful completion of this investigation will result photovoltaic materials displaying of high photovoltaic efficiency at low cost. This innovative research will also meet individual soldier energy requirements, communications, building and facility energy requirements and space-based electric power systems. The market that can be addressed by the proposed technology will be over $1.5B by 2013. The project will provide a unique opportunity for the students and postdocs to be involved in the interdisciplinary research. An essential and important component of this research will be the dissemination of the result through patent, publications in journals and presentations in conferences.

ProgramReference.Text: RET SUPP-Res Exp for Tchr Supp
REU SUPP-Res Exp for Ugrd Supp

POR.DRECONTENT:
Abstract

This project has used ragioregular polyhexylthiophene (RRP3HT), nanodiamonds (ND)- RRP3HT ND-poly(3-dodecylthiophene), polyethylene dioxythiophene, another derivatives of polythiophene based hybrid film to study the photo-electrochemical properties. The initially results showed 8 to 10 times of photocurrent for nanodiamond containing RRP3HT conducting polymer. The effect of photoelectrochemical has been found to be dependent on size of diamond from micro to nano with in the blend film. This project has also shown for the first time the use of boron nitride (BN) with RRP3HT blend for photoelectrochemical studies. The short circuit current, fill factor a power conversion efficiency (η) of several blend films were studied, and compared. We have developed the new way of making thin film of graphene layer. The photoelectrochemical studies of graphene/RRPHTh-ND and graphene/ RRPHTh-BN were studied. The ND-RRP3HT and hBN-RRP3HT blend structures have shown improved efficiency than the blend film of MD-RRPHTH whereas comparable photoelectrochemical properties have been found with ND-RRP3HT and BN-RRP3H blend films. This project has provided support for undergraduate and graduate students to work in interdisciplinary field.  

Technical Details

The conducting polymer (polythiophene, polyethylenedioxythiophene, polyaniline, polyhexylthiophene, N-methyl thiophene, RRP3HT) containing metal oxide nanoparticles hybrid structured films are used for photoelectrochemical and photovoltaic applications. We have shown in this project that the ND-RRP3HT hybrid films exhibited 8 to 10 times better photochemical properties than ZnO- RRP3HT and TiO2- RRP3HT hybrid structures. We also investigated the advantage for the use of hexagonal boron hydride with conducting polymer. We have examined several nanomaterials to find the improved photo-efficiencies in hybrid conducting polymer films. The nanomaterial hybrid with conducting polymer is a good material for photoelectrochemical and photovoltaic applications.

Project Report

The project is about forming of blends of conjugated polymers and nanomaterials which could be the potential electrode material for photoelectrochemical application. The ragioregular polyhexylthiophene and nanodiamond and ragioregular polyhexylthiophene-boronitride films have shown to be the very good photo-converting materials. The photochemical properties of ND-RRP3HT hybrid films is dependent of the size of the diamond nanoparticles. We have investigated different size of diamond particles dioamond-RRP3HT hybrid structured film for photoelectrochemical studies. We have also studied the photoelectrochemical properties of ragioregular polyhexylthiophene and several derivatives of polythiophene under this project. We have fabricated and characterized photoelectrochemical cell based on ragioregular polyhexylthiophene hybrid film on polypyrrole-graphene films. We have observed for the first time that ND-RRPHTh with hybrid films have superior photoelectrochemical properties. We also studied that hexagonal boron nitride (hBN) hybrid with RRPHTh film that gives better photocurrent than ND-RRPHTh. Our novel method of fabrication of nanomaterial films using composite conducting polymer precursor may find applications for photoelectrochemical and photovoltaic fields.

 


Last Modified: 04/06/2016
Modified by: Ashok Kumar
